title: [Self-Directed] Metacognitive Skill Development Course Based on Chemical Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Basic chemistry concept comprehension and problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: A course emphasizing the acquisition of metacognitive strategies through chemistry problem-solving processes in an LMS accessible via smartphones, requiring mobile learning optimization as most learners lack PCs.

learning_goals: Learners can apply metacognitive strategies in the planning phase (problem identification, goal setting, strategy selection) of chemical problem-solving with 80% accuracy.
Learners can utilize monitoring skills (self-checking, progress evaluation) in over 70% of problem-solving situations.

Learners can record metacognitive reflections at least twice during the evaluation phase (reviewing outcomes, reflecting on strategies, deriving improvements) after completing chemical problem-solving.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
